column15: Authority is the Cop’s special ability (1–10); each point increases the ability to command respect, gain cooperation, and call in institutional resources. Low ranks (1–3): influence civilians, get backup, basic warrants. Mid ranks (4–6): command squads, override lower ranks, access sensitive info. High ranks (7–10): influence city policy, override orders, command whole precincts. Edge cases: abuse or overuse can cause public backlash, internal affairs review, demotion, or loss of Authority; corruption or failed ops can lead to rapid reputation loss. Unique: cops are bound by codes of conduct and law—excesses (brutality, corruption) can grant short-term gain but cause severe long-term penalties.
